level.heading: VACANCY IN THE OFFICE OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA (ยง-904)

level.text: When the Attorney General resigns his or her office prior to expiration of the term, the resignation shall be in writing and in triplicate.

The resigning Attorney General shall forward one (1) triplicate original of the resignation to the Mayor, one (1) triplicate original to the Chief Deputy Attorney General, and one (1) triplicate original to the Chairperson of the D.C. Board of Elections and Ethics.

Within five (5) working days of receipt of the resignation, the Board shall certify the seat vacant, effective as provided by the resignation, and issue the appropriate notification as provided in this chapter.

When the Attorney General dies while still serving his or her term of office, the Board shall, within five (5) working days of notice of the death, certify the seat vacant and issue the appropriate notification as provided in this chapter.

When a vacancy in the office of Attorney General is declared by court order, the Board shall, as soon as practicable after the court declaration, notify the Chief Deputy Attorney General of the vacancy by registered mail.
When a vacancy in the office of Attorney General occurs as a result of a recall election, the Board shall, as soon as practicable after certification of the election results, do the following:
Notify the Chief Deputy Attorney General; and
Issue the appropriate notification as provided in this chapter.
